trans-unit.source: Describes the light-emitting diodes (LEDs) and audible alarms used to monitor the status of the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Describes the light-emitting diodes (LEDs) and audible alarms used to monitor the status of the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Use StorSimple monitoring indicators to manage your device
trans-unit.target: Use StorSimple monitoring indicators to manage your device

trans-unit.source: Your StorSimple device includes light-emitting diodes (LEDs) and alarms that you can use to monitor the modules and overall status of the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Your StorSimple device includes light-emitting diodes (LEDs) and alarms that you can use to monitor the modules and overall status of the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: The monitoring indicators can be found on the hardware components of the device's primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: The monitoring indicators can be found on the hardware components of the device's primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: The monitoring indicators can be either LEDs or audible alarms.
trans-unit.target: The monitoring indicators can be either LEDs or audible alarms.

trans-unit.source: There are three LED states used to indicate the status of a module: green, flashing green to red-amber, or red-amber.
trans-unit.target: There are three LED states used to indicate the status of a module: green, flashing green to red-amber, or red-amber.

trans-unit.source: Green LEDs represent a healthy operating status.
trans-unit.target: Green LEDs represent a healthy operating status.

trans-unit.source: Flashing green to red-amber LEDs represent the presence of non-critical conditions that might require user intervention.
trans-unit.target: Flashing green to red-amber LEDs represent the presence of non-critical conditions that might require user intervention.

trans-unit.source: Red-amber LEDs indicate that there is a critical fault present within the module.
trans-unit.target: Red-amber LEDs indicate that there is a critical fault present within the module.

trans-unit.source: The remainder of this article describes the various monitoring indicator LEDs, their locations on the StorSimple device, the device status based on the LED states, and any associated audible alarms.
trans-unit.target: The remainder of this article describes the various monitoring indicator LEDs, their locations on the StorSimple device, the device status based on the LED states, and any associated audible alarms.

trans-unit.source: The front panel, also known as the *operations panel* or *ops panel*, displays the aggregate status of all the modules in the system.
trans-unit.target: The front panel, also known as the *operations panel* or *ops panel*, displays the aggregate status of all the modules in the system.

trans-unit.source: The front panel is identical on the StorSimple device and the EBOD enclosure, and is illustrated below.
trans-unit.target: The front panel is identical on the StorSimple device and the EBOD enclosure, and is illustrated below.

trans-unit.source: The front panel contains the following indicators:
trans-unit.target: The front panel contains the following indicators:

trans-unit.source: The major difference between the front panel LEDs for the device and those for the EBOD enclosure is the **System Unit Identification Number** shown on the LED display.
trans-unit.target: The major difference between the front panel LEDs for the device and those for the EBOD enclosure is the **System Unit Identification Number** shown on the LED display.

trans-unit.source: The default unit ID displayed on the device is **00**, whereas the default unit ID displayed on the EBOD enclosure is **01**.
trans-unit.target: The default unit ID displayed on the device is **00**, whereas the default unit ID displayed on the EBOD enclosure is **01**.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to quickly differentiate between the device and the EBOD enclosure when the device is turned on.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to quickly differentiate between the device and the EBOD enclosure when the device is turned on.

trans-unit.source: If your device is turned off, use the information provided in [Turn on a new device](storsimple-turn-device-on-or-off.md#turn-on-a-new-device) to differentiate the device from the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: If your device is turned off, use the information provided in [Turn on a new device](storsimple-turn-device-on-or-off.md#turn-on-a-new-device) to differentiate the device from the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to identify the status indicated by the LEDs on the front panel for the device or the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to identify the status indicated by the LEDs on the front panel for the device or the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: AC power lost, operating on backup power, or AC power ON and the controller modules were removed.
trans-unit.target: AC power lost, operating on backup power, or AC power ON and the controller modules were removed.

trans-unit.source: Ops panel power on (5s) test state
trans-unit.target: Ops panel power on (5s) test state

trans-unit.source: PCM fault LEDs, fan fault LEDs
trans-unit.target: PCM fault LEDs, fan fault LEDs

trans-unit.source: Any PCM fault, fan fault, over or under temperature
trans-unit.target: Any PCM fault, fan fault, over or under temperature

trans-unit.source: Module status LED on controller module.
trans-unit.target: Module status LED on controller module.

trans-unit.source: PCM fault LEDs, fan fault LEDs
trans-unit.target: PCM fault LEDs, fan fault LEDs

trans-unit.source: Unknown controller module type installed, I2C bus failure, controller module vital product data (VPD) configuration error
trans-unit.target: Unknown controller module type installed, I2C bus failure, controller module vital product data (VPD) configuration error

trans-unit.source: Power cooling module (PCM) indicator LEDs can be found on the back of the primary enclosure or EBOD enclosure on each PCM module.
trans-unit.target: Power cooling module (PCM) indicator LEDs can be found on the back of the primary enclosure or EBOD enclosure on each PCM module.

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses how to use the following LEDs to monitor the status of your StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses how to use the following LEDs to monitor the status of your StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs for the primary enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs for the primary enclosure

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs for the EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs for the EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs for the primary enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs for the primary enclosure

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device has a 764W PCM module with an additional battery.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device has a 764W PCM module with an additional battery.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows the LED panel for the device.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows the LED panel for the device.

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs on the primary enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs on the primary enclosure

trans-unit.source: The status of the PCM is indicated on the LED panel.
trans-unit.target: The status of the PCM is indicated on the LED panel.

trans-unit.source: The device PCM LED panel has six LEDs.
trans-unit.target: The device PCM LED panel has six LEDs.

trans-unit.source: Four of these LEDs display the status of the power supply and the fan.
trans-unit.target: Four of these LEDs display the status of the power supply and the fan.

trans-unit.source: The remaining two LEDs indicate the status of the backup battery module in the PCM.You can use the following tables to determine the status of the PCM.
trans-unit.target: The remaining two LEDs indicate the status of the backup battery module in the PCM.You can use the following tables to determine the status of the PCM.

trans-unit.source: PCM indicator LEDs for power supply and fan
trans-unit.target: PCM indicator LEDs for power supply and fan

trans-unit.source: PCM fault (over amp, over voltage, over current)
trans-unit.target: PCM fault (over amp, over voltage, over current)

trans-unit.source: PCM indicator LEDs for the backup battery
trans-unit.target: PCM indicator LEDs for the backup battery

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs for the EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs for the EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: The EBOD enclosure has a 580W PCM and no additional battery.
trans-unit.target: The EBOD enclosure has a 580W PCM and no additional battery.

trans-unit.source: The PCM panel for the EBOD enclosure has indicator LEDs only for the power supplies and the fan.
trans-unit.target: The PCM panel for the EBOD enclosure has indicator LEDs only for the power supplies and the fan.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows these LEDs.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows these LEDs.

trans-unit.source: PCM LEDs on the EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: PCM LEDs on the EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: You can use the following table to determine the status of the PCM.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following table to determine the status of the PCM.

trans-unit.source: PCM fault (over amp, over voltage, over current
trans-unit.target: PCM fault (over amp, over voltage, over current

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device contains LEDs for the primary controller and the EBOD controller modules.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device contains LEDs for the primary controller and the EBOD controller modules.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring LEDs for the primary controller
trans-unit.target: Monitoring LEDs for the primary controller

trans-unit.source: The following illustration helps you identify the LEDs on the primary controller.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration helps you identify the LEDs on the primary controller.

trans-unit.source: (All of the components are listed to aid in orientation.)
trans-unit.target: (All of the components are listed to aid in orientation.)

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to determine whether the controller module is operating correctly.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to determine whether the controller module is operating correctly.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the module is being identified.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the module is being identified.

trans-unit.source: If the blue LED is blinking on a running controller, then the controller is the active controller and the other one is the standby controller.
trans-unit.target: If the blue LED is blinking on a running controller, then the controller is the active controller and the other one is the standby controller.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Identify the active controller on your device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md#identify-the-active-controller-on-your-device).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Identify the active controller on your device](storsimple-controller-replacement.md#identify-the-active-controller-on-your-device).

trans-unit.source: Indicates a fault in the controller.
trans-unit.target: Indicates a fault in the controller.

trans-unit.source: Steady green indicates that the controller is OK.
trans-unit.target: Steady green indicates that the controller is OK.

trans-unit.source: Flashing green indicates a controller VPD configuration error.
trans-unit.target: Flashing green indicates a controller VPD configuration error.

trans-unit.source: Steady green indicates a connection with no current activity.
trans-unit.target: Steady green indicates a connection with no current activity.

trans-unit.source: Flashing green indicates the connection has ongoing activity.
trans-unit.target: Flashing green indicates the connection has ongoing activity.

trans-unit.source: Right side indicates link/network activity: (steady green) link active, (flashing green) network activity.
trans-unit.target: Right side indicates link/network activity: (steady green) link active, (flashing green) network activity.

trans-unit.source: Left side indicates network speed: (yellow) 1000 Mb/s, (green) 100 Mb/s, and (OFF) 10 Mb/s.
trans-unit.target: Left side indicates network speed: (yellow) 1000 Mb/s, (green) 100 Mb/s, and (OFF) 10 Mb/s.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the component model, this light might blink even if the network interface is not enabled.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the component model, this light might blink even if the network interface is not enabled.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the boot progress when the controller is turned on.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the boot progress when the controller is turned on.

trans-unit.source: If the StorSimple device fails to boot, this LED will help Microsoft Support identify the point in the boot process at which the failure occurred.
trans-unit.target: If the StorSimple device fails to boot, this LED will help Microsoft Support identify the point in the boot process at which the failure occurred.

trans-unit.source: If the fault LED is lit, there is a problem with the controller module that might be resolved by restarting the controller.
trans-unit.target: If the fault LED is lit, there is a problem with the controller module that might be resolved by restarting the controller.

trans-unit.source: Please contact Microsoft Support if restarting the controller does not resolve this issue.
trans-unit.target: Please contact Microsoft Support if restarting the controller does not resolve this issue.

trans-unit.source: Monitoring LEDs for the EBOD (EBOD enclosure)
trans-unit.target: Monitoring LEDs for the EBOD (EBOD enclosure)

trans-unit.source: Each of the 6 Gb/s SAS EBOD controllers has LEDs that indicate its status as shown in the following illustration.
trans-unit.target: Each of the 6 Gb/s SAS EBOD controllers has LEDs that indicate its status as shown in the following illustration.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to determine whether the EBOD controller module is operating normally.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to determine whether the EBOD controller module is operating normally.

trans-unit.source: External host port connection – no activity
trans-unit.target: External host port connection – no activity

trans-unit.source: Disk drive indicator LEDs for the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: Disk drive indicator LEDs for the primary enclosure and EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple device has disk drives located in both the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple device has disk drives located in both the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: Each disk drive contains monitoring indicator LEDs, as described in this section.
trans-unit.target: Each disk drive contains monitoring indicator LEDs, as described in this section.

trans-unit.source: For the disk drives, the drive status is indicated by a green LED and a red-amber LED mounted on the front of each drive carrier module.
trans-unit.target: For the disk drives, the drive status is indicated by a green LED and a red-amber LED mounted on the front of each drive carrier module.

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows these LEDs.
trans-unit.target: The following illustration shows these LEDs.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to determine the state of each disk drive, which in turn affects the overall front panel LED status.
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to determine the state of each disk drive, which in turn affects the overall front panel LED status.

trans-unit.source: Disk drive indicator LEDs for the EBOD enclosure
trans-unit.target: Disk drive indicator LEDs for the EBOD enclosure

trans-unit.source: SCSI Enclosure Services (SES) device identity set
trans-unit.target: SCSI Enclosure Services (SES) device identity set

trans-unit.source: A StorSimple device contains audible alarms associated with both the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.
trans-unit.target: A StorSimple device contains audible alarms associated with both the primary enclosure and the EBOD enclosure.

trans-unit.source: An audible alarm is located on the front panel (also known as the ops panel) of both enclosures.
trans-unit.target: An audible alarm is located on the front panel (also known as the ops panel) of both enclosures.

trans-unit.source: The audible alarm indicates when a fault condition is present.
trans-unit.target: The audible alarm indicates when a fault condition is present.

trans-unit.source: The following conditions will activate the alarm:
trans-unit.target: The following conditions will activate the alarm:

trans-unit.source: Removal of a power cooling module (PCM)
trans-unit.target: Removal of a power cooling module (PCM)

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the various alarm states.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the various alarm states.

trans-unit.source: Fault mode: 1 second on/1 second off
trans-unit.target: Fault mode: 1 second on/1 second off

trans-unit.source: Transition to S2 or S3 (see notes)
trans-unit.target: Transition to S2 or S3 (see notes)

trans-unit.source: In alarm state S1, if you do not press mute within 2 minutes, the state automatically transitions to S2 or S3.
trans-unit.target: In alarm state S1, if you do not press mute within 2 minutes, the state automatically transitions to S2 or S3.

trans-unit.source: Alarm states S1 to S4 return to S0 after the fault condition is cleared.
trans-unit.target: Alarm states S1 to S4 return to S0 after the fault condition is cleared.

trans-unit.source: Critical fault state S4 can be entered from any other state.
trans-unit.target: Critical fault state S4 can be entered from any other state.

trans-unit.source: You can mute the audible alarm by pressing the mute button on the ops panel.
trans-unit.target: You can mute the audible alarm by pressing the mute button on the ops panel.

trans-unit.source: Automatic muting will occur after two minutes if the mute switch is not manually operated.
trans-unit.target: Automatic muting will occur after two minutes if the mute switch is not manually operated.

trans-unit.source: When the alarm is muted, it will continue to sound with short intermittent beeps to indicate that a problem still exists.
trans-unit.target: When the alarm is muted, it will continue to sound with short intermittent beeps to indicate that a problem still exists.

trans-unit.source: The alarm will be silent when all the problems are cleared.
trans-unit.target: The alarm will be silent when all the problems are cleared.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the various alarm conditions.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the various alarm conditions.

trans-unit.source: PCM alert – loss of DC power from a single PCM
trans-unit.target: PCM alert – loss of DC power from a single PCM

trans-unit.source: PCM alert – loss of DC power from a single PCM
trans-unit.target: PCM alert – loss of DC power from a single PCM

trans-unit.source: SBB interface module fault – No functioning modules remaining
trans-unit.target: SBB interface module fault – No functioning modules remaining

trans-unit.source: Warning – no loss of drive power
trans-unit.target: Warning – no loss of drive power

trans-unit.source: Fault – critical; loss of drive power
trans-unit.target: Fault – critical; loss of drive power

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [StorSimple hardware components and status](storsimple-monitor-hardware-status.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [StorSimple hardware components and status](storsimple-monitor-hardware-status.md).
